instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-0045: What is 820-0045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
hi,
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> motherboard

device turns on and seems apple logo while loading system shutdown or restart
Device turns on, apple logo shows up but during loading screen it shuts down


I tried to install via usb, it turned off again


no liquid

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Test the board alone on the desk; without any peripheral connected.
Just check for USB activity, or external video.
See if still turns off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
solved
I changed the CPU thermal paste.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
hi,
problem repeated
Is the cpu faulty?

threads.message: It always ends failing on these boards...
